EXTRACTED VALUE: Falls short of being an at-home-alone single-player masterpiece. [Issue #15]
There are more trick-based challenges than ever, but aside from the new slow-motion control, Tony Hawk is skating through the same old territory.
Rich with charm, ingenuity, artistry and genuine delight. [Jan 2007, p.77]
Don't buy it looking for huge innovations, but by all means expect entertainment by the superhero-load. [Issue 18, p.72]
A useless co-op mode feels tacked-on. [Feb 2006, p.86]
While I really enjoyed the look and feel of the graphics and controls, there is still a nagging feeling that the game is just too much of a clone.
Like a fierce haymaker to the jaw, the visuals of Fight Night Round 3 will knock you on your rear end.
Fun enough, but not the facelift we were hoping for. Plus, online totally carries it. [Sept 2008, p.70]
